**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 372 **Domain** [Air](/Domains.aspx?ID=65) **Range** 500 feet **Target** 1 creature **Defense** Fortitude --- Giving the air a push, you buffet the target with a powerful gust of wind; it must attempt a Fortitude save. **Critical Success** The target is unaffected.
**Success** The target is [pushed](/Rules.aspx?ID=451) 5 feet away from you.
**Failure** The target is pushed 10 feet away from you.
**Critical Failure** The target is pushed 10 feet away from you and knocked [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31).
_source.name: Pushing Gust

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Limited">
[Putrefy Food and Drink](/Spells.aspx?ID=823)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Necromancy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=117" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #158: Sixty Feet Under](/Sources.aspx?ID=47) pg. 77</row>

**Traditions**
[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 cubic foot of clean food or water
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You cause otherwise edible food to rot and spoil instantly, and water and other liquids to become brackish and undrinkable. [_Holy water_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=245), [_unholy water_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=248), and similar food and drink of significance are spoiled by this spell, unless they are associated with a deity of decay or putrefaction, but it has no effect on creatures of any type, [potions](/Equipment.aspx?Category=15&Subcategory=18), or [alchemical elixirs](/Equipment.aspx?Category=6&Subcategory=8). One cubic foot of liquid is roughly 8 gallons.

---
**Heightened (2nd)** You can target an alchemical elixir with this spell, attempting a [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) check against it. If you succeed, the elixir spoils and becomes a mundane item.

**Heightened (3rd)** You can target a potion or alchemical elixir with this spell, attempting a counteract check against it. If you succeed, the elixir or potion spoils and becomes a mundane item.
_source.name: Putrefy Food and Drink

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Quick Sort](/Spells.aspx?ID=978)
<actions string="Three Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 124 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [material](/Rules.aspx?ID=282), [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 10 feet

**Target** up to 200 unattended objects in range, each of light Bulk or less
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** up to 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You magically sort a group of objects into neat stacks or piles. You can sort the objects in two different ways. The first option is to separate them into different piles depending on an easily observed factor, such as color or shape. Alternatively, you can sort the objects into ordered stacks depending on a clearly indicated notation, such as a page number, title, or date. The objects sort themselves throughout the duration, though it takes less time per object to sort a smaller number of objects, down to a single round for 30 or fewer objects.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** The spell can sort up to 400 objects in a minute, or 60 objects in a round.

**Heightened (5th)** The spell can sort up to 800 objects in a minute, or 120 objects in a round.
_source.name: Quick Sort

<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Read Aura](/Spells.aspx?ID=1646)
<actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Detection" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=43" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 352</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** 1 minute

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 object
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You focus on the target object, opening your mind to perceive magical auras. When the casting is complete, you know whether that item is magical. You or anyone you advise about the aura gains a +2 circumstance bonus to [Identify Magic](/Actions.aspx?ID=24) on the item. If the object is [illusory](/Traits.aspx?ID=92), you detect this only if the effect's rank is lower than the rank of your _read aura_ spell.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** You can target up to 10 objects.

**Heightened (6th)** You can target any number of objects.
_source.name: Read Aura

<title level="1" right="Focus 1" pfs="Standard">
[Read Fate](/Spells.aspx?ID=1802)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Cleric" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=26" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Prediction" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=132" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 375</row>

**Domain**
[Fate](/Domains.aspx?ID=75)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 creature other than you
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You attempt to learn more about the target's fate in the short term, usually within the next day for most prosaic creatures, or the next hour or less for someone likely to have multiple rapid experiences, such as someone actively adventuring.

 You learn a single enigmatic word connected to the creature's fate in that time frame. Fate is notoriously inscrutable, and the word isn't necessarily meant to be taken at face value, so the meaning is often clear only in hindsight. The GM rolls a secret DC 6 flat check. If the creature's fate is too uncertain, or on a failed flat check, the spell yields the word “inconclusive.” Either way, the creature is then temporarily immune for 24 hours.
_source.name: Read Fate

<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Read the Air](/Spells.aspx?ID=981)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 125 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You take a deep breath as you survey a social situation, showing courtesy to all around you as your intuition swiftly picks up clues about social contexts and unspoken assumptions of behavior. Your body language subconsciously changes to take advantage of this information and use it in your own interactions with those creatures. 

 As part of Casting this Spell, you [Recall Knowledge](/Actions.aspx?ID=26) using [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) to gain information about the immediate social situation. You also gain a +1 status bonus on your next [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) check to [Make an Impression](/Actions.aspx?ID=50) on those creatures present when you cast this spell, as long as the check occurs during the duration of the spell. You can _read the air_ only once in a given social situation; casting it again has no effect.
_source.name: Read the Air

<title level="1" right="Focus 1" pfs="Standard">
[Redact](/Spells.aspx?ID=606)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Gods & Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=17) pg. 114 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Domain**
[Glyph](/Domains.aspx?ID=46)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [material](/Rules.aspx?ID=282), [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** unattended written materials of up to 1 Bulk or less
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 day
</row>

</column>

---

You strike mention of a specific name from one or more documents. When you cast the spell, give one proper name, be it a creature, location, or object. Any mention of that name within the document becomes blurred, smudged, or otherwise completely illegible. Epithets and unambiguous references to the name are redacted as well; for instance, redacting the name of the goddess [Sarenrae](/Deities.aspx?ID=16) from a book would also remove references to her title “the Dawnflower.”

---
**Heightened (3rd)** Instead of striking out a given name, you can replace it with a different name you choose. Epithets and references are substituted with similar ones relating to the replacement name. Anyone reading the text can attempt a Perception or [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) check against your spell DC to notice the altered text, though that doesn’t tell them what the original said.

**Heightened (4th)** At your choice, the duration is unlimited.
_source.name: Redact

<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Reinforce Eidolon](/Spells.aspx?ID=1050)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Summoner" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=392" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 145 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 100 feet

**Target** your [eidolon](Eidolons.aspx)
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 round
</row>

</column>

---

You focus deeply on the link between you and your eidolon and reinforce your eidolon's defenses. Your eidolon gains a +1 status bonus to AC and saving throws, plus resistance to all damage equal to half the spell's level. Your eidolon can benefit from either [_boost eidolon_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1045) or _reinforce eidolon_, but not both; if you cast one of these spells during the other's duration, the newer spell replaces the older one.
_source.name: Reinforce Eidolon

<title level="1" right="Focus 1" pfs="">
[Rejuvenating Flames](/Spells.aspx?ID=850)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Fists of the Ruby Phoenix</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Fire" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=72" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
<trait label="Healing" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=89" />
<trait label="Necromancy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=117" />
<trait label="Sorcerer" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=148" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #168: King of the Mountain](/Sources.aspx?ID=87) pg. 74</row>

**Bloodline**
[Phoenix](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=15)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Area** 15-foot cone

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Saving Throw** 
[basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex

</row>

</column>

---

You create a gout of flame that both heals and burns. You restore 1d4 HP to all allies in the area, and those allies gain a +1 status bonus to Fortitude saves for 1 minute. Enemies in the area take 1d4 fire damage with a basic Reflex save.

---
**Heightened (+1)** You restore an additional 1d4 HP to your allies and deal an additional 1d4 fire damage to enemies.
_source.name: Rejuvenating Flames

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Restyle](/Spells.aspx?ID=984)
<actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 126 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** 1 minute ([material](/Rules.aspx?ID=282), [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284))

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 piece of clothing currently worn by you or an ally
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** unlimited
</row>

</column>

---

You permanently change the appearance of one piece of clothing currently worn by you or an ally to better fit your aesthetic sensibilities. You can change its color, texture, pattern, and other minor parts of its design, but the changes can't alter the clothing's overall shape, size, or purpose. The changes can't increase the quality of the craftsmanship or artistry of the piece of clothing, but particularly gauche choices for the new color and pattern might decrease its aesthetic appeal. This spell transforms existing materials into the desired appearance and never alters the material or creates more material than what's originally part of the object. The object's statistics also remain unchanged.
_source.name: Restyle

<title level="1" right="Focus 1" pfs="Standard">
[Rising Surf](/Spells.aspx?ID=1310)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Move" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=114" />
<trait label="Water" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=165" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Rage of Elements](/Sources.aspx?ID=205) pg. 61, [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 201 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You create a wave of water that you ride, banking around obstacles and surfing to higher ground. You move up to 35 feet, raising yourself up to 5 feet above the ground. (You can avoid many types of [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453) in this way.) You must end your movement on an unoccupied space where you have solid footing. This movement isn't a Stride, but you measure the distance in a similar way, and it still triggers reactions caused by movement. You can't transport anyone else with you.

---
**Heightened (+2)** Increase the distance you move by 5 feet and the maximum height traveled above the ground by 5 feet.
_source.name: Rising Surf

<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Root Reading](/Spells.aspx?ID=1409)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Wood" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=508" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Rage of Elements](/Sources.aspx?ID=205) pg. 197</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Area** 30-foot emanation

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You gain general insights into the immediate vicinity by sending your sense through the root systems of trees and bushes. If there are any [unnoticed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=41) Medium or larger creatures in the area, you learn of their presence and they're [undetected](/Conditions.aspx?ID=39) to you. You can immediately attempt to [Seek](/Actions.aspx?ID=84) an undetected creature, and you gain a +1 status bonus to this attempt and any of your other attempts to Seek [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=22) or undetected creatures until the end of your next turn. You also learn if any such creatures passed through this area in the last hour, although you get only the vaguest sense of direction from the spell. If you begin to [Track](/Actions.aspx?ID=66) a creature detected in this way, you gain a +1 status bonus to the initial check.
_source.name: Root Reading

<actions string="Two Actions" />

<traits>
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />

<trait label="Water" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=165" />

[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 60 feet

**Target** 1 creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You cause a splash of cold water to descend on an ally's head, granting some temporary vigor. The target gains 1d4 temporary Hit Points, which last for 1 minute. The target is then temporarily immune to the temporary Hit Points from _rousing splash_ for 10 minutes. The target can also attempt an immediate flat check to recover from a single source of [persistent acid or fire damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29), with the DC reduction from appropriate assistance.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The amount of temporary Hit Points granted increases by 1d4.
_source.name: Rousing Splash

Creatures attempting to attack the target must attempt a Will save each time. If the target uses a [hostile action](/Rules.aspx?ID=300), the spell ends. **Critical Success** _Sanctuary_ ends.
**Success** The creature can attempt its attack and any other attacks against the target this turn.
**Failure** The creature can't attack the target and wastes the action. It can't attempt further attacks against the target this turn.
**Critical Failure** The creature wastes the action and can't attempt to attack the target for the rest of sanctuary's duration.

You evoke a mass of fire into the air around your outstretched fist. For the remainder of your turn, you can blast targets within 30 feet with this fire by spending a single action which has the [attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15) and [concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32) traits. When you do so, attempt a ranged spell attack roll. If you hit, you inflict 2d8 fire damage. On a critical hit, the target takes 1d6 [persistent fire damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29).

---
**Heightened (+1)** The base damage increases by 1d8 and the persistent fire damage on a critical hit increases by 2.
_source.name: Scorching Blast

May contain spoilers from Extinction Curse **Source** [Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On](/Sources.aspx?ID=21) pg. 78 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** 60 feet **Area** 10-foot burst **Duration** sustained for up to 1 minute --- You blast the area with grit that scours away soil and gets into creatures’ eyes. For the duration of the spell, any plant-based difficult terrain smaller than a tree becomes loose, allowing each 5-foot square of it to be cleared with a single Interact action. In addition, _scouring sand_ attempts to counteract [_entangle_](/Spells.aspx?ID=103) and other effects that create or manipulate plant-based terrain in its area. Successfully counteracting an effect removes only the portion of its area that overlaps with _scouring sand’s_ area. After one such attempt, the effect is temporarily immune to _scouring sand’s_ counteract for 24 hours. Each creature in the area when you Cast this Spell or that ends its turn in the area must attempt a Reflex save. **Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Failure** The creature is [dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=7) for 1 minute or until it uses an Interact action to get the sand out of its eyes.
**Critical Failure** As failure, but the creature is also [blinded](/Conditions.aspx?ID=1) for its next action. --- **Heightened (3rd)** Once per round when you [Sustain the Spell](/Actions.aspx?ID=73), you can move the center of the burst to a spot within range. **Heightened (6th)** As the 3rd-level version, except the range is 120 feet and the area is a 20-foot burst.
_source.name: Scouring Sand

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Seashell of Stolen Sound](/Spells.aspx?ID=993)
<actions string="Reaction" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Sonic" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=147" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 127 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [focus](/Rules.aspx?ID=285), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

**Trigger** A creature within range begins to make a sound.

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** until your next daily preparations
</row>

</column>

---

You store a sound in a seashell to use as you will: the last words of a loved one, a dragon's mighty roar, the compromising conversation between two powerful diplomats, or even more strange and secret. As part of Casting this Spell, you must present an unbroken seashell. When you Cast the Spell, magic swirls around the triggering creature, copying the sounds they make, as well as any background noise, for the next minute and storing them in the seashell.

 You or another creature can then play the sound back from the seashell during the spell's duration by Interacting with the seashell, but once the sounds have been played back, the seashell shatters and the spell ends.

 As normal for spells with a duration until your next daily preparations, you can choose to continue expending the spell slot to prolong the duration of an existing _seashell of stolen sound_ for another day. While the spell faithfully copies the sounds around the target, it doesn't reproduce any special [auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16) or [sonic](/Traits.aspx?ID=147) effects of the sound.
_source.name: Seashell of Stolen Sound

Each enemy in the area when you Cast the Spell or that starts its turn in the area takes 1d4 mental damage and must attempt a Will save. **Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Shattering Gem](/Spells.aspx?ID=585)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Earth" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=55" />

<column gap="tiny">

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Deities**
[Ashukharma](/Deities.aspx?ID=187), [Mammon](/Deities.aspx?ID=68), [Sairazul](/Deities.aspx?ID=107), [Sairazul](/Deities.aspx?ID=107), [The Resplendent Court](/Deities.aspx?ID=272), [Yuelral](/Deities.aspx?ID=111)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

A large gem floats around the target in an erratic pattern. The gem has 5 Hit Points. Each time a creature Strikes the target, the target attempts a DC 11 flat check. On a success, the gem blocks the attack, so the attack first damages the gem and then applies any remaining damage to the target. If the gem is reduced to 0 Hit Points, it shatters, immediately dealing the creature that destroyed it 1d8 slashing damage (basic Reflex save), as long as that creature is within 10 feet of the target.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The gem has 5 additional HP, and the damage dealt by its detonation increases by 1d8.
_source.name: Shattering Gem

---

You raise a magical shield of force. This counts as using the [Raise a Shield](/Actions.aspx?ID=98) action, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.

 While the spell is in effect, you can use the [Shield Block](/Feats.aspx?ID=839) reaction with your magic shield. The shield has Hardness 5. You can use the spell's reaction to reduce damage from any spell or magical effect, even if it doesn't deal physical damage. After you use Shield Block, the spell ends and you can't cast it again for 10 minutes.

---
**Heightened (+2)** The shield's Hardness increases by 5.

---

Reinforcing veins of ore run through the target's arm, letting it ward off blows with its bare skin. It can use the [Raise a Shield](/Actions.aspx?ID=98) action to instead raise its arm, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC. It can [Shield Block](/Feats.aspx?ID=839) with its Raised arm as well; when it does, the target reduces the damage as if it had a shield with Hardness 4 and 15 Hit Points. This shield doesn't have a Broken Threshold, and the spell ends if the shield's Hit Points are expended.

 This spell doesn't modify the target's [unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199) attacks and can't be used to make a [shield bash](/Weapons.aspx?ID=40) Strike. Casting or coming under the effects of this spell also counts as using a metallic item with regards to anathema.

---
**Heightened (+2)** The Hardness increases by 4, and the Hit Points increase by 15.
_source.name: Shielded Arm

<row gap="medium">

**Target** 1 creature or object
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** unlimited (see below)
</row>

</column>

---

You harmlessly place your unique magical sigil, which is about 1 square inch in size, on the targeted creature or object. The mark can be visible or invisible, and you can change it from one state to another by using an Interact action to touch the target. The mark can be scrubbed or scraped off with 5 minutes of work. If it's on a creature, it fades naturally over the course of a week. The time before the mark fades increases depending on your heightened rank.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** The sigil instead fades after 1 month.

**Heightened (5th)** The sigil instead fades after 1 year.

**Heightened (7th)** The sigil never fades.
_source.name: Sigil

**Source** [Rage of Elements](/Sources.aspx?ID=205) pg. 121 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Range** 1,000 feet **Area** 30-foot burst --- With a pinch of metallic powder and gunpowder, you call forth blistering red energy that shoots straight upward into the air and explodes, unleashing a crackling boom. Over time, you might even customize your own pattern and color for the skyrocket as you refine the spell. You can't change the direction or distance of the rocket—it must go straight up, continuing up to the maximum range if possible. If the rocket explodes at its maximum height, the bright light can be seen up to 10 miles away, and the sound of the explosion can be heard up to 1 mile away under clear weather conditions. If the rocket explodes in an enclosed space smaller than the full size of the burst, each creature in the area takes 1d10 sonic damage depending on the result of its Reflex save. **Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** The creature takes half damage.
**Failure** The creature takes full damage and is [dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=7) for 1 round.
**Critical Failure** The creature takes double damage and is [blinded](/Conditions.aspx?ID=1) for 1 round. --- **Heightened (+1)** The sonic damage increases by 1d10.
_source.name: Signal Skyrocket

If you have two hands free, you can target two creatures with this spell; otherwise, you target one. Make a spell attack roll against each target's AC. This deals 2d4 slashing damage. A creature that falls [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38) from this spell doesn't fall [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31) or release what it's holding. This spell doesn't prevent creatures from waking up due to a successful Perception check, limiting its utility in combat. **Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.

They fall [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31) and release what they're holding, and they can't attempt Perception checks to wake up. When the duration ends, the creature is sleeping normally instead of automatically waking up.

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Spirit Link](/Spells.aspx?ID=1686)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Healing" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=89" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Spirit" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=149" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 358</row>

**Traditions**
[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Lesson**
[Lesson of Life](/Lessons.aspx?ID=18)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 willing creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 10 minutes
</row>

</column>

---

You form a spiritual link with another creature, taking in its pain. When you Cast this Spell and at the start of each of your turns, if the target is below maximum Hit Points, it regains 2 Hit Points (or the difference between its current and maximum Hit Points, if that's lower). You lose as many Hit Points as the target regained.

 This is a spiritual transfer, so no effects apply that would increase the Hit Points the target regains or decrease the Hit Points you lose. This transfer also ignores any temporary Hit Points you or the target have. Since this effect doesn't involve vitality or void energy, _spirit link_ works even if you or the target is [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160). While the duration persists, you gain no benefit from [regeneration](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=26) or [fast healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=15). You can Dismiss this spell, and if you're ever at 0 Hit Points, _spirit link_ ends automatically.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The number of Hit Points transferred each time increases by 2.
_source.name: Spirit Link

<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Spirit Object](/Spells.aspx?ID=810)
<actions string="Single Action or Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Hex" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=324" />
<trait label="Necromancy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=117" />
<trait label="Witch" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=323" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Legends](/Sources.aspx?ID=40) pg. 32</row>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) Per design team clarification, an item animated by the spirit object hex uses the spellcaster’s spell DC as its AC. Its Hardness and Hit Points remain unchanged from their normal values as listed on page 577 of the Core Rulebook._

**Patron Theme**
[Baba Yaga](/Patrons.aspx?ID=9)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 unattended object up to 1 Bulk
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

Using a sliver of Baba Yaga's power, you briefly bring an object to life. The object gains a means of locomotion, such as sprouting chicken legs, and Strides up to 25 feet to a space you decide within range. If you spent 2 actions Casting the Spell, the object then attacks one creature of your choice adjacent to its new space. Make a melee spell attack roll against the creature. On a success, the creature takes 3d4 bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (as appropriate for the object), and on a critical success, it takes double damage.

---
**Heightened (+1)** Increase the maximum Bulk of the target by 1 and the damage by 1d4.
_source.name: Spirit Object

<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Spout](/Spells.aspx?ID=1002)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
<trait label="Water" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=165" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 130 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Area** a 5-foot cube

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Saving Throw** 
Reflex

</row>

</column>

---

Water blasts upward, coming out of the ground, rising from a pool, or even manifesting from thin air. Any creatures in the area take 2d4 bludgeoning damage, with a [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex saving throw. A creature that critically fails its save is disoriented by the explosion of water, becoming off-guard until the end of your next turn.

 You can change this spell's area to a 5-foot burst, provided you center the burst in a body of water. This body of water can be as small as a pond or creek, but not as small as a puddle or bathtub.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The damage increases by 1d4.
_source.name: Spout

**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 233 2.0 **Mystery** [Cosmos](/Mysteries.aspx?ID=4) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Area** 15-foot cone **Saving Throw** Reflex --- You fling a spray of tiny shooting stars, dealing 1d4 fire damage. Each creature in the area must attempt a Reflex save. **Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** The creature takes half damage and is [dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=7) for 1 round.
**Failure** The creature takes full damage and is dazzled for 3 rounds.
**Critical Failure** The creature takes double damage and is dazzled for 1 minute. --- **Heightened (+1)** Increase the damage by 1d4.
_source.name: Spray of Stars

<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Cleric" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=26" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
<trait label="Fortune" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=76" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Dark Archive](/Sources.aspx?ID=129) pg. 143</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 60 feet

**Target** you and 1 ally
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** sustained up to 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You bond yourself to a cherished friend, vowing to share their fate for good or for ill. Whenever an effect would require both you and the target to attempt a saving throw, if one of you succeeds at your saving throw and the other critically fails, you can choose to both fail instead. You and the ally must agree to fail; otherwise, use your normal save results instead.
_source.name: String of Fate

May contain spoilers from Strength of Thousands **Source** [Pathfinder #169: Kindled Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=94) pg. 75 **Lesson** [Lesson of Calamity](/Lessons.aspx?ID=12) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283) **Range** 60 feet **Target** 1 creature **Saving Throw** Reflex **Duration** sustained up to 1 minute --- With a twist of a finger, you send a creature careening on a haphazard trajectory. The target must attempt a Reflex save. **Critical Success** The target is unaffected.
**Success** The target takes a –2 status penalty to [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) and [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) checks.
**Failure** As success, and each time the target Strides, it uses the first 5 feet of movement of the Stride to move 5 feet in a random direction (this is [forced movement](/Rules.aspx?ID=451)). This has no effect on a creature with only 5 feet of movement.
**Critical Failure** As failure, except you control the direction of the target's first 5 feet of movement of the Stride.
_source.name: Stumbling Curse

You materialize a handheld [musical instrument](/Equipment.aspx?ID=37) in your grasp. The instrument is typical for its type, but it plays for only you. It vanishes when the spell ends. If you cast _summon instrument_ again, any instrument you previously summoned disappears.

---
**Heightened (5th)** The instrument is instead a virtuoso handheld instrument.
_source.name: Summon Instrument

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Summon Lesser Servitor](/Spells.aspx?ID=1010)
<actions string="Three Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Conjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=33" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 134 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) The summon lesser servitor spell cannot be used to summon imps._

**Tradition**
[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [material](/Rules.aspx?ID=282), [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** sustained up to 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

While deities jealously guard their most powerful servants from the summoning spells of those who aren't steeped in the faith, this spell allows you to conjure an inhabitant of the [Outer Sphere](/Rules.aspx?ID=308) with or without the deity's permission. You summon a [celestial](/Traits.aspx?ID=23), [monitor](/Traits.aspx?ID=111), or [fiend](/Traits.aspx?ID=70) whose level is –1 to fight on your behalf. Alternatively, you can choose a magical animal from the Outer Sphere as your lesser servitor. This animal is your choice of an [eagle](/Monsters.aspx?ID=172), [guard dog](/Monsters.aspx?ID=124), or [raven](/Monsters.aspx?ID=781). It gains the alignment matching your deity (or you, if you don't have a deity) and has the following trait depending on the alignment it gained: celestial for lawful, monitor for neutral, or fiend for evil.

 You can't summon a creature if it is opposed to your deity's alignment on either axis (or opposed to your alignment if you don't follow a deity). For example, if you deity is lawful good, you can't summon a chaotic or evil creature. The GM might determine that deities restrict specific types of creatures even if their alignments aren't diametrically opposed. For example, [Pharasma](/Deities.aspx?ID=14) would restrict the summoning of [sahkils](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=208).

 Heightening the spell increases the maximum level of creature you can summon and might add additional animal servitors, which otherwise work like the eagle, guard dog, and raven.

---
**Heightened (2nd)** Level 1.

**Heightened (3rd)** Level 2. You can summon a [black bear](/Monsters.aspx?ID=566), [giant bat](/Monsters.aspx?ID=46), or [leopard](/Monsters.aspx?ID=67).

**Heightened (4th)** Level 3. You can summon a [great white shark](/Monsters.aspx?ID=365) or [tiger](/Monsters.aspx?ID=69).
_source.name: Summon Lesser Servitor

May contain spoilers from Strength of Thousands **Source** [Pathfinder #171: Hurricane's Howl](/Sources.aspx?ID=101) pg. 77 **Tradition** [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** 30 feet **Area** 10-foot burst **Duration** 1 minute --- You call upon the spirits of the soil to twist and churn, transforming the terrain in the targeted area into a sodden mess. The area becomes difficult terrain. Creatures in the area when you Cast this Spell must attempt a Reflex saving throw. **Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Failure** The creature sinks partially into the mud. The creature takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds (except for its swim Speed, if any) and becomes [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16). These effects last until the creature leaves the area or until the end of its next turn, whichever comes first.
**Critical Failure** As failure, but the penalty to Speeds (except Swim speed) is –15 feet. --- **Heightened (3rd)** The range increases to 60 feet, and the area increases to a 20-foot burst.
_source.name: Swampcall

You extend your senses through a multitude of crawling and flying creatures. You create a crawling swarm in your square. You can hear through the swarm as if using your normal auditory senses. The first time you Sustain the Spell each round, you can move the swarm 10 feet along the ground in any direction. The swarm has AC 15 and a +0 bonus to its saves. Any damage dealt to the swarm destroys it and ends the spell.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** The swarm has the benefits of [_spider climb_](/Spells.aspx?ID=299).

**Heightened (5th)** The swarm has a fly Speed of 10 feet. You can see through the swarm using your visual senses.

**Heightened (7th)** The swarm gains a 10-foot status bonus to its Speeds.
_source.name: Swarmsense

---

You harmlessly place your unique magic sigil, which is about 1 square inch in size, on your targets. When you Cast the Spell, you set the duration by choosing a time at which point the sigil flashes dimly three times. After that point, the spell ends. Even though spell durations aren't normally exact, the effects of _synchronize_ are precise to the second. The timer is based on the place where the spell was cast, so entering a plane or area where time flows differently changes how the time elapses.

---
**Heightened (2nd)** The spell can target up to 20 willing creatures.
_source.name: Synchronize

<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Plant" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=125" />
<trait label="Wood" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=508" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Rage of Elements](/Sources.aspx?ID=205) pg. 198</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 willing creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 round
</row>

</column>

---

Roots sprout from the flesh of the target and coil across the floor or around objects, reinforcing their stance or grip. The targeted creature gains a +1 circumstance bonus to their Fortitude DC against attempts to [Shove](/Actions.aspx?ID=38) them and a +1 circumstance bonus to their Reflex DC against attempts to [Disarm](/Actions.aspx?ID=41) or [Trip](/Actions.aspx?ID=40) them. This bonus also applies to saving throws against spells or effects that would attempt to remove a held item from their grasp.
_source.name: Take Root

<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Tame](/Spells.aspx?ID=1014)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Auditory" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=16" />
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Enchantment" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=61" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=106" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 135 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 10 feet

**Target** 1 non-hostile domesticated [animal](/Traits.aspx?ID=9)
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Saving Throw** 
Will

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

As you make comforting sounds and gestures, you approach the target in a friendly manner combining caution and confidence. You improve the target's attitude to you by one step ([unfriendly](/Conditions.aspx?ID=40) to neutral, neutral to [friendly](/Conditions.aspx?ID=18), friendly to [helpful](/Conditions.aspx?ID=21)) for the duration of the spell unless it succeeds at a Will save. Afterward, the target is temporarily immune for 1 day.

 This spell works on only domesticated animals; for example, you could use it on guard dogs or stray dogs, but not feral dogs or wolves. If the socialization of the animal is in question, the decision is up to the GM.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** The duration becomes 10 minutes.

**Heightened (6th)** The duration becomes 1 hour.
_source.name: Tame

<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 362</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 unattended object of Light bulk or less
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** sustained
</row>

</column>

---

You create a floating, magical hand, either [invisible](/Conditions.aspx?ID=26) or ghostlike, that grasps the target object and levitates it slowly up to 20 feet in any direction. When you Sustain the spell, you can move the object an additional 20 feet. If the object is in the air when the spell ends, the object falls.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** You can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.

**Heightened (5th)** The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.

**Heightened (7th)** The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 2 or less.
_source.name: Telekinetic Hand

<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Telekinetic Rend](/Spells.aspx?ID=1130)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
<trait label="Psychic" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=430" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Dark Archive](/Sources.aspx?ID=129) pg. 17</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 60 feet

**Area** 2 non-overlapping 5-foot bursts

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Saving Throw** 
[basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude

</row>

</column>

---

Your mind creates a violent axis of motion in a nearby space. You deal your choice of 1d6 bludgeoning or 1d6 slashing damage to all creatures in the area, with a basic Fortitude save. A creature large enough to be in more than one of the bursts takes damage only once.

---
**Heightened (+2)** The damage increases by 1d6.

---

<column gap="tiny">
**Amp** Your thoughts expand in scope and power. The bursts deal 1d6 bludgeoning damage and 1d6 slashing damage, instead of the usual damage. A creature that critically fails its save is also [stunned 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=36).

**Amp Heightened (+2)**
Both types of damage increase by 1d6 instead of just one. Add a third non-overlapping 5-foot burst to the area.
</column>
_source.name: Telekinetic Rend

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Temporary Tool](/Spells.aspx?ID=590)
<actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Conjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=33" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Gods & Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=17) pg. 110 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) The temporary tool spell can be used to create only simple tools, and therefore cannot create kits, which are complex objects made of multiple pieces, or objects made of any specific precious material._

**Tradition**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1)

**Deities**
[Brigh](/Deities.aspx?ID=33), [Findeladlara](/Deities.aspx?ID=109), [Jaidi](/Deities.aspx?ID=155), [Magrim](/Deities.aspx?ID=90), [Magrim](/Deities.aspx?ID=90)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** 1 minute

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** until used or 1 minute; see text
</row>

</column>

---

You conjure a temporary simple tool, such as a shovel or rope into your hands. It lasts until it is used for a single activity or for 1 minute, whichever comes first, after which it disappears. The tool is obviously temporarily conjured, and thus can’t be sold or passed off as a genuine item.
_source.name: Temporary Tool

<title level="1" right="Focus 1" pfs="Standard">
[Tentacular Limbs](/Spells.aspx?ID=517)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
<trait label="Morph" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=113" />
<trait label="Sorcerer" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=148" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 405 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Bloodline**
[Aberrant](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=1)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

Your arms turn into long, pliable tentacles, increasing your reach when you're delivering touch range spells and making unarmed Strikes with your arms (such as fist and claw Strikes) to 10 feet. This doesn't change the reach of your melee weapon attacks. During the duration, whenever you Cast a Spell, you can add an additional action to that spell's casting to temporarily extend your reach to 20 feet to deliver that spell.

---
**Heightened (+2)** When you add an additional action to a spell to temporarily extend your reach, your reach increases by an additional 10 feet to deliver that spell.
_source.name: Tentacular Limbs

_source.summary_markdown: Your arms turn into long, pliable tentacles, increasing your reach when you’re delivering touch range spells and making unarmed Strikes with your arms.

_source.markdown:
**Source** [Gods & Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=17) pg. 111 2.0 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Deity** [Dispater](/Deities.aspx?ID=66) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** 30 feet **Target** 1 creature **Saving Throw** Reflex **Duration** 1 minute or until dismissed; see text --- You use magical chains, vines, or other tethers to bind your target to you. The creature can still try to [Escape](/Actions.aspx?ID=79), and it or others can break the tethers by attacking them (the tethers have AC 15 and 10 Hit Points). You must stay within 30 feet of the target while it is tethered; moving more than 30 feet away from your target ends the spell. The target must attempt a Reflex save. **Critical Success** The target is unaffected.
**Success** The target takes a –5-foot circumstance penalty to its Speed as long as it is within 30 feet of you.
**Failure** The target takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speed and cannot move more than 30 feet away from you until it Escapes or the spell ends.
**Critical Failure** The target is [immobilized](/Conditions.aspx?ID=24) until it Escapes or the spell ends. --- **Heightened (+1)** The tethers’ AC increases by 3 and their Hit Points increase by 10.
_source.name: Tether

You create numerous phantom copies of your weapon arm, hiding your true movements and rendering your attacks unpredictable. You gain a +2 status bonus to [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) checks. <title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Thoughtful Gift](/Spells.aspx?ID=722)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Conjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=33" />
<trait label="Teleportation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=156" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 226 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 120 feet

**Target** 1 willing creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You teleport one object of light or negligible Bulk held in your hand to the target. The object appears instantly in the target's hand, if they have a free hand, or at their feet if they don't. The target knows what object you are attempting to send them. If the target is unconscious or refuses to accept your gift, or if the spell would teleport a creature (even if the creature is inside an [extradimensional](/Traits.aspx?ID=67) container), the spell fails.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** The spell's range increases to 500 feet.

**Heightened (5th)** As 3rd level, and the object's maximum Bulk increases to 1. You can Cast the Spell with 3 actions instead of 1; doing so increases the range to 1 mile and you don't need line of sight to the target, but you must be extremely familiar with the target.
_source.name: Thoughtful Gift

<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You swing your massive weapon, creating a wave of sonic vibrations that topples creatures. Make a melee Strike with your two-handed weapon. Each creature in a 15-foot cone from you must attempt a [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save against your spell DC or take 2 sonic damage. On a critical failure, the creature is knocked [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31). The target of your Strike must be within the cone or the effect fails.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The damage increases by 1.

<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Time Sense](/Spells.aspx?ID=1193)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Dark Archive](/Sources.aspx?ID=129) pg. 183</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Mystery**
[Time](/Mysteries.aspx?ID=9)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

When you Cast the Spell, you gain a perfect sense of time. You can learn exactly what time it is, down to the second. You can instead choose to gain a perfect sense of the calendar if you have knowledge in that area—if you're trained in [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10), you can learn exactly how long it is until sunrise and how many days until the next solstice. If you're trained in [Astronomy Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8), you can learn precisely when any known predictable astronomical conjunction will begin and end, and so on.

 You can gain a +1 status bonus to one attack roll, Perception check, saving throw, or skill check you take on the same turn you cast _time sense_ that requires extremely precise timing. If you choose to gain this bonus, you can't gain it again for 1 hour.
_source.name: Time Sense

</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Blood Lords</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Necromancy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=117" />

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">

[basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude

---

With this spell born of Kemnebi's sadistic love of torture, you batter a creature's internal organs, leaving no external signs of the immense pain you delivered. The target takes bludgeoning damage equal to 1d4 + your spellcasting modifier with a [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save. If it critically fails, the target is also [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=15) until the start of your next turn. Creatures that lack internal organs are unaffected by this spell.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The bludgeoning damage increases by 1d4.
_source.name: Torturous Trauma

<title level="1" right="Focus 1" pfs="Standard">
[Touch of Corruption](/Spells.aspx?ID=819)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Champion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=24" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
<trait label="Necromancy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=117" />
<trait label="Negative" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=118" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 229 <sup>2.0</sup>, [Gamemastery Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=22) pg. 247</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 willing undead creature or 1 living creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You infuse the target with negative energy. If the target is living, this deals 1d6 negative damage (basic Fortitude save); on a failed save, the target also takes a –2 status penalty to AC for 1 round.

 If the target is a willing [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160) creature, the target instead regains 6 Hit Points, and if you are the undead target, you also gain a +2 status bonus to damage rolls for 1 round.

---
**Heightened (+1)** Increase the damage dealt to a living creature by 1d6 or increase the Hit Points regained by undead by 6.
_source.name: Touch of Corruption

<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Tremor Signs](/Spells.aspx?ID=1342)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Earth" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=55" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Rage of Elements](/Sources.aspx?ID=205) pg. 97</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 120 feet

**Target** 1 creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You send a series of tremors, no longer than a short sentence of speech, toward your target. If the target is within range and connected to the same body of earth as you, the vibrations reach the target through the ground. You need neither line of sight nor line of effect, so a target on another floor of a building is a valid target.

 The target can give a brief, vibrational response as a reaction, or as a free action on their next turn, but they must be within range to do so. If they respond, their response is delivered to you through tremors you feel, as with the original message. The tremors impart a clear meaning only if you and the target know that meaning, such as three tremors for a specific warning, two for another. Neither of you can impart a nuanced or new meaning using this spell.

 A creature that has [tremorsense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=40) can feel the vibrations from this spell if the creature is within range of the vibrations at any point during their journey to any target.

---
**Heightened (4th)** The spell can target up to 5 creatures.
_source.name: Tremor Signs

---

You loosen the link between yourself and your eidolon, allowing it to travel farther from you for a short period of time. While the spell is active, your eidolon can travel an unlimited distance away from you. When the spell ends, if your eidolon is more than 100 feet away from you, it unmanifests.

<traits>

<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />

---

You reach within for a different part of yourself, and you set it free, transforming your body into another form. You polymorph into any form listed in [_pest form_](/Spells.aspx?ID=217), which lasts 10 minutes. All other _untamed form_ shapes last 1 minute. You can add more shapes to your _untamed form_ list with druid feats; your feat might grant  you some or all of the shapes from a given [polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127) spell. When you transform into a shape granted by a spell, you gain all the effects of the shape you chose from a version of the spell heightened to _untamed form'_s rank. _Untamed form_ allows you to use your own shapeshifting training more easily than most polymorph spells. When you choose to use your own attack modifier while polymorphed instead of the form's default attack modifier, you gain a +2 status bonus to your attack rolls.

---
**Heightened (2nd)** You can transform into shapes listed in [_animal form_](/Spells.aspx?ID=10).
_source.name: Untamed Form

_source.markdown:
**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 383 **Duration** 1 minute --- You transform just a part of your body. Choose any one effect that matches an untamed order feat you have.
  • **Untamed Form** Your hands transform into incredibly sharp claws. Untamed claws are an unarmed attack, have the [agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170) and [finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179) traits, and deal 1d6 slashing damage. You can still hold and use items with your hands while they're transformed by this spell, but you must have a hand free to attack with it.
  • **Insect Shape** Your mouth becomes deadly jaws. Untamed jaws are an unarmed attack that deal 1d8 piercing damage.
  • **Elemental Shape** You shift your body to be partially composed of elemental matter, granting you resistance 5 to critical hits and precision damage.
  • **Plant Shape** Your arms become long vines, increasing your [reach](/Traits.aspx?ID=192) to 10 feet (or 15 feet with a reach weapon).
  • **Soaring Shape** You must cast _untamed shift_ using 2 actions for this benefit. You grow wings from your back, gaining a fly Speed of 30 feet.
--- **Heightened (6th)** You can choose up to two effects from the list. Untamed claws leave terrible, ragged wounds that also deal 2d6 [persistent bleed damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) on a hit, and untamed jaws are envenomed, also dealing 2d6 persistent poison damage on a hit. **Heightened (10th)** You can choose up to three effects from the list. Untamed claws deal 4d6 persistent bleed damage on a hit, and untamed jaws deal 4d6 persistent poison damage on a hit.
_source.name: Untamed Shift

**Target** 1 ally

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 round
</row>

</column>

---

Your performance makes allies feel they can succeed at anything. This counts as having prepared to [Aid](/Actions.aspx?ID=75) your ally on a skill check of your choice. When you later use the Aid reaction, you can roll [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12) instead of the normal skill check, and if you roll a failure, you get a success instead. If you are legendary in Performance, you automatically critically succeed. The GM might rule that you can't use this ability if the act of encouraging your ally would interfere with the skill check (such as a check to [Sneak](/Actions.aspx?ID=63) quietly or maintain a disguise).
_source.name: Uplifting Overture

---

Whenever you speak or make any other sound vocally, you can make your vocalization seem to originate from somewhere else within 60 feet, and you can change that apparent location freely as you vocalize. Any creature that hears the sound can attempt to disbelieve your illusion.

---
**Heightened (2nd)** The spell's duration increases to 1 hour, and you can also change the tone, quality, and other aspects of your voice. Before a creature can attempt to disbelieve your illusion, it must actively attempt a Perception check or otherwise use actions to interact with the sound.
_source.name: Ventriloquism

<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />

<column gap="tiny">

**Range** 30 feet

</row>

<row gap="medium">

---

You create a single plant seed imbued with primal energy and throw it onto a surface, where it gradually sprouts into a Medium plant. After 10 minutes, the plant is sturdy enough to provide [standard cover](/Rules.aspx?ID=459), and its space is [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453). The plant is laden with nutritious nuts or fruit sufficient to feed one Medium creature for a day. The plant has AC 10, Hardness 5, and 20 Hit Points.

---
**Heightened (+1)** You create and throw an additional seed, which grows into an additional plant within range.
_source.name: Verdant Sprout

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Limited">
[Verminous Lure](/Spells.aspx?ID=855)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Strength of Thousands</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Olfactory" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=246" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #169: Kindled Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=94) pg. 76</row>

**Tradition**
[Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 creature or object
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 10 minutes
</row>

</column>

---

Upon casting, the target emits a musk that's captivating to certain animals. Tiny animals and animal swarms of any size within range must attempt a Will save. On a failure, non-[hostile](/Conditions.aspx?ID=23) [animals](/Traits.aspx?ID=9) or animal [swarms](/Domains.aspx?ID=53) try to touch the target. If hostile, such creatures choose to attack the target instead of other foes, if able to do so without spending additional actions or exposing themselves to additional danger.

 _Verminous lure_ doesn't change animals' attitudes towards the target and is easily overridden by more direct control, such as the [Command an Animal](/Actions.aspx?ID=58) action. Animals with imprecise sense can use their [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=33) as a [precise sense](/Rules.aspx?ID=411) against the target.
_source.name: Verminous Lure

Adjacent creatures that hit you with a melee attack, as well as creatures that hit you with [unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199) attacks, take 1 piercing damage each time they do. ---
**Heightened (+1)** The damage increases by 1d4.

<row gap="medium">

---

You call forth a line of bushes native to the region to spring from the ground. The wall of shrubs stands in a line 60 feet long, is less than 5 feet tall, and is a foot thick, providing [lesser cover](/Rules.aspx?ID=459).

---
**Heightened (3rd)** The shrubs are now 10 feet tall and 5 feet thick and provide standard cover. The duration of the spell increases to 10 minutes.

**Heightened (5th)** Instead of a line, the shrubs can be made in a ring with a diameter of up to 30 feet that's 10 feet tall and 5 feet thick. The shrubs provide greater cover. The duration of the spell increases to 1 hour.

---

When you walk, the earth warps beneath your feet—your steps extend, distance contracts, and everything is just a little bit closer. You gain a +5-foot status bonus to your Speed until the end of your turn. You then Stride twice. You can use warp step to [Burrow](/Actions.aspx?ID=93), [Climb](/Actions.aspx?ID=33), [Fly](/Actions.aspx?ID=94), or [Swim](/Actions.aspx?ID=39) instead of Stride if you have the corresponding movement type.
_source.name: Warp Step

<title level="1" right="Focus 1" pfs="Standard">
[Warped Terrain](/Spells.aspx?ID=537)
<actions string="Single Action to Three Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
<trait label="Illusion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=92" />
<trait label="Visual" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=163" />
<trait label="Wizard" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=166" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 407 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 60 feet

**Area** 5-foot burst or more

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You create illusory hazards that cover all surfaces in the area (typically the ground). Any creature moving through the illusion treats the squares as difficult terrain. A creature can attempt to disbelieve the effect as normal after using a Seek action or otherwise spending actions interacting with the illusion. If it successfully disbelieves, it ignores the effect for the remaining duration. For each additional action you use casting the spell, the burst's radius increases by 5 feet, to a maximum of 10 extra feet for 3 actions.

---
**Heightened (4th)** You can make the illusion appear in the air rather than on a surface, causing it to function as difficult terrain for flying creatures.
_source.name: Warped Terrain

<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Wash Your Luck](/Spells.aspx?ID=1031)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Fortune" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=76" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 140 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

Some practitioners argue this spell literally washes your fortunes of all influences, malign or benign, while others claim it simply cleanses your mind of obsessions about luck and destiny. You adjust your garments, change the posture of your chair, fidget with a religious symbol, or make some other innocuous and personally significant action to wash away bad luck.

 Once during the spell's duration, before rolling a check, you can cancel out a [misfortune](/Traits.aspx?ID=110) effect on that roll, as normal when a [fortune](/Traits.aspx?ID=76) and misfortune effect apply to the same roll. After canceling out the misfortune effect, the spell ends, and you are then temporarily immune to _wash your luck_ for 10 minutes.
_source.name: Wash Your Luck

[Weaken Earth](/Spells.aspx?ID=1345)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Earth" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=55" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Rage of Elements](/Sources.aspx?ID=205) pg. 97</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 creature, unattended object, or hazard or structure made of stone or earth
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Defense**
Fortitude

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You weaken the bonds that hold earth and stone together. If your target has Hardness, you can affect one contiguous object, up to a 5-foot cube, or one creature, decreasing the Hardness by 5, to a minimum of 0. If the target lacks Hardness, it gains weakness 3 to physical damage. A target with a Fortitude modifier can attempt a Fortitude saving throw, negating the effect on a success.

---
**Heightened (+2)** Hardness decreases by 5, the size of a contiguous object increases by one 5-foot cube, and the weakness increases by 3.
_source.name: Weaken Earth

</row>

---

With a touch, you cause the target to break into fibrous strands that then weave themselves into a woven mundane object of the same Bulk or less, such as a basket, hat, shield, or mat. You can create up to 4 objects with one casting of this spell, providing their total Bulk doesn't exceed the Bulk of your target. The objects have Hardness 2 and 8 Hit Points.

---
**Heightened (+1)** Increase the maximum Bulk that you can target by 1 and the maximum number of objects you can create by 2.

You suppress sound in an area, preventing anyone from giving away valuable secrets. **Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 387 **Patron Theme** [Wilding Steward](/Patrons.aspx?ID=18) **Range** 30 feet **Target** 1 creature **Defense** Will **Duration** sustained up to 1 minute --- Your patron's majesty—or their displeasure—comes in a growl from your throat, making other creatures reluctant to harm you. The target must attempt a Will save; if the creature is an [animal](/Traits.aspx?ID=9), [fungus](/Traits.aspx?ID=77), or [plant](/Traits.aspx?ID=125), it takes a –1 circumstance penalty to its save. **Critical Success** The target is unaffected.
**Success** When the target attempts an attack roll or skill check that would harm you, it takes a –2 status penalty to its roll.
**Failure** As success, but the target also becomes [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34) each time it damages you.
**Critical Failure** As failure, but the sickened value is 2.
_source.name: Wilding Word

**Source** [Gods & Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=17) pg. 112 2.0 **Domain** [Cold](/Domains.aspx?ID=41) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** 60 feet **Target** 1 creature --- You fling a hollow icicle filled with winter’s wrath. Make a spell attack against a target within range. The bolt deals 1d8 piercing damage and lodges in the target. At the end of the target’s next turn, the bolt shatters, releasing a whirl of snow and ice that deals 1d12 cold damage to the target and all adjacent creatures. The bolt can be removed with an Interact action, which causes it to melt harmlessly without detonating. **Critical Success** The initial bolt deals full damage and is especially well anchored, taking 2 Interact actions to remove. The bolt’s explosion deals double damage.
**Success** The bolt and its explosion deal full damage. --- **Heightened (+1)** The initial damage increases by 1d8 and the secondary damage increases by 1d12.
_source.name: Winter Bolt

**Source** [Gods & Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=17) pg. 113 2.0 _[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) The Targets entry for withering grasp should be “1 creature or unattended object”, not “1 creature or object.” When used on an unattended object, the object takes persistent damage on your next turn._ **Domain** [Decay](/Domains.aspx?ID=42) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** touch **Target** 1 creature or object --- Your touch rots organic material and decays objects. Make a melee spell attack roll. Your touch deals 1d12 negative damage plus 1d4 [persistent negative damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29). If a creature uses an item to block _withering grasp_, such as with the [Shield Block](/Feats.aspx?ID=839) reaction, the item is automatically affected, but the creature does not take damage (even if there is damage left over after the shield’s Hardness). Unlike normal negative damage, the negative damage from _withering grasp_ damages objects, constructs, and the like by eroding them away. **Critical Success** Your touch deals double damage (both initial and persistent). If you target an object, lower its Hardness by 4 for 1 minute.
**Success** Your touch deals full damage. If you target an object, lower its Hardness by 2 for 1 minute. --- **Heightened (+1)** The damage increases by 1d12 and the persistent damage increases by 1. If you target an object, lower its Hardness by an additional 1 point on both a success and a critical success.
_source.name: Withering Grasp

[Wooden Fists](/Spells.aspx?ID=1417)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Rage of Elements](/Sources.aspx?ID=205) pg. 199</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

Your arms and hands swell with new growth, transforming into tree trunks twice as big as their current size. Your fists deal 1d6 bludgeoning damage, lose the [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188) trait, and have [reach](/Traits.aspx?ID=192).

---
**Heightened (3rd)** Your fists gain the [magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103) trait and become a [_striking_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) weapon, increasing the damage your fists deal to 2d6 bludgeoning.

**Heightened (7th)** Your fists gain the magical trait and become a _greater striking_ weapon, increasing the damage your fists deal to 3d6 bludgeoning. The duration is 10 minutes.

**Heightened (9th)** Your fists gain the magical trait and become a _major striking_ weapon, increasing the damage your fists deal to 4d6 bludgeoning. The duration is 1 hour.
_source.name: Wooden Fists

<title level="1" right="Focus 1" pfs="Standard">
[Word of Truth](/Spells.aspx?ID=1842)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Cleric" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=26" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 380</row>

**Domain**
[Truth](/Domains.aspx?ID=95)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** sustained up to 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You speak a statement that you believe to be true and that is free of any attempt to deceive through twisting words, omission, and so on. The statement must be 25 words or fewer. A symbol of your deity glows above your head and lasts for the spell's duration, and anyone who sees you and hears you speak knows instinctively that you believe what you say is true. This assurance of honesty grants you a +2 status bonus to [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) checks as long as the symbol persists. You can Dismiss the spell, and if you say something that you don't believe is entirely true, the spell ends before you complete your statement.
_source.name: Word of Truth
