**Source** [Gods & Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=17) pg. 117 2.0 **Domain** [Star](/Domains.aspx?ID=52) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** 60 feet **Target** 1 creature **Saving Throw** Fortitude **Duration** 1 day --- You call a tiny star to orbit a creature in a sparkling halo before shooting up into the heavens, where it marks the creature’s rough location. The target must attempt a Fortitude save. **Critical Success** The target is unaffected.
**Success** The target is [dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=7) for 1 round.
**Failure** The target is dazzled for 1 round. While the spell persists, as long as you can see the night sky and the target is visible from the same night sky, you can sense the approximate direction and distance to the creature by using a single action, which has the [concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32) trait. This is exact enough to track the creature, but not pinpoint their exact square (for instance, to make an attack). You can set a number of _zenith stars_ equal to your Wisdom modifier; if you exceed this number, your oldest _zenith star_ is automatically Dismissed.
**Critical Failure** As failure, but the target is [blinded](/Conditions.aspx?ID=1) for 1 round. --- **Heightened (+1)** The duration increases by 1 day. **Heightened (4th)** You ignore the concealed [condition](/Conditions.aspx?ID=4) against targets marked by _zenith star_.
_source.name: Zenith Star

A creature taking persistent damage from this spell takes a –10-foot status bonus to its Speeds. **Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.

The symptoms of scurvy include fatigue, joint pain, loose teeth, and internal hemorrhaging.
**Critical Success** The target is unaffected.
**Success** The target is [enfeebled 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=13) for 1 minute.
**Failure** The target is afflicted with advanced scurvy at stage 1.
**Critical Failure** The target is afflicted with advanced scurvy at stage 2. **Advanced Scurvy** ([disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46)) **Level** 4; for 1 day after eating fresh fruit, a creature gains a +2 circumstance bonus to their next saving throw against this affliction; **Stage 1** enfeebled 1 and the damage dealt by [persistent bleed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) effects is increased by 1 (1 day); **Stage 2** enfeebled 1, [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=15), and the damage dealt by persistent bleed effects is increased by 1d4 (2 days); **Stage 3** enfeebled 2, fatigued, and the damage dealt by persistent bleed effects is increased by 1d6 (4 days)
_source.name: Advanced Scurvy

<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Limited">
[Allfood](/Spells.aspx?ID=1425)
<actions string="" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Sky King's Tomb</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #194: Cult of the Cave Worm](/Sources.aspx?ID=209) pg. 79</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** 1 minute ([somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283),  [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284))

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 unattended non-magical object of 1 Bulk or less
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You transform one object into an edible substance that any living creature can chew, swallow, and safely digest. This _allfood_ always has a bland taste and slightly gooey consistency, regardless of its original nature. One bulk of _allfood_ provides enough sustenance to feed one Medium creature for a day.

 After 1 day, if no one has eaten the _allfood_, it reverts to its original form. Most Small creatures eat one-quarter as much as a Medium creature and most Tiny creatures eat one-sixteenth as much, while most Large creatures eat 10 times as much, Huge creatures need 100 times as much, and so on.

---
**Heightened (+1)** Double the maximum bulk (to a maximum of 256 bulk at 10th level).
_source.name: Allfood

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 315 **Tradition** [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Deity** [Lamashtu](/Deities.aspx?ID=287) **Duration** 1 minute --- You call upon primal energy to transform yourself into a Medium animal battle form. When you Cast this Spell, choose a listed battle form. You can decide the specific type of animal (such as lion or snow leopard for cat), but this has no effect on the form's Size or statistics. While in this form, you gain the [animal](/Traits.aspx?ID=9) trait. You can Dismiss the spell. You gain specific abilities based on the animal you choose:
  • AC = 16 + your level. Ignore your armor's check penalty and Speed reduction.
  • 5 temporary Hit Points.
  • [Low-light vision](/Rules.aspx?ID=416) and [imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412) [scent](/Rules.aspx?ID=417) 30 feet.
  • One or more [unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199) melee attacks specific to the battle form you choose, which are the only attacks you can Strike with. You're trained with them. Your attack modifier is +9, and your damage bonus is +1. These attacks are Strength based (for the purpose of the [enfeebled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=13) condition, for example). If your unarmed attack bonus is higher, you can use it instead.
  • [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) modifier of +9, unless your own is higher.
You also gain specific abilities based on the animal you choose: - **Ape** Speed 25 feet, climb 20 feet; Melee fist, Damage 2d6 bludgeoning. - **Bear** Speed 30 feet; **Melee** jaws, **Damage** 2d8 piercing; **Melee** claw (agile), **Damage** 1d8 slashing. - **Bull** Speed 30 feet; **Melee** horn, **Damage** 2d8 piercing. - **Canine** Speed 40 feet; **Melee** jaws, **Damage** 2d8 piercing. - **Cat** Speed 40 feet; **Melee** jaws, **Damage** 2d6 piercing; **Melee** claw ([agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)), **Damage** 1d10 slashing. - **Deer** Speed 50 feet; **Melee** antler, **Damage** 2d6 piercing. - **Frog** Speed 25 feet, swim 25 feet; **Melee** jaws, **Damage** 2d6 bludgeoning; **Melee** tongue ([reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 2d4 bludgeoning. - **Shark** swim 35 feet; **Melee** jaws, **Damage** 2d8 piercing; breathe underwater but not in air. - **Snake** Speed 20 feet, climb 20 feet, swim 20 feet; **Melee** fangs, **Damage** 2d4 piercing plus 1d6 poison. --- **Heightened (3rd)** You instead gain 10 temporary HP, AC = 17 + your level, attack modifier +14, damage bonus +5, and Athletics +14. **Heightened (4th)** Your battle form is Large and your attacks have 10-foot reach. You instead gain 15 temporary HP, AC = 18 + your level, attack modifier +16, damage bonus +9, and Athletics +16. **Heightened (5th)** Your battle form is Huge and your attacks have 15-foot reach. You instead gain 20 temporary HP, AC = 18 + your level, attack modifier +18, damage bonus +7 and double the number of damage dice, and Athletics +20.
_source.name: Animal Form

[Animal Messenger](/Spells.aspx?ID=1441)
<actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=106" />

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 315</row>

[Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** 1 minute

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 120 feet

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** see text
</row>

</column>

---

You offer food, and an ordinary Tiny animal within range approaches to eat it. You imprint the image, direction, and distance of an obvious place or landmark well known to you within the animal. You can also attach a small object or note up to light Bulk to it. The animal does its best to reach the destination; if it makes it there, it waits nearby and allows nonhostile creatures to approach and remove the attached object. The spell ends after the message is delivered or after 24 hours, whichever comes first. If there are no Tiny wild animals in range, the spell is lost.
_source.name: Animal Messenger

<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />

<row gap="medium">

---

You use your mind to manipulate unattended objects in the area, temporarily animating them to attack. The objects hover in the air, then hurl themselves at nearby creatures in a chaotic flurry of debris. This assault deals 2d10 bludgeoning damage (basic Reflex save) to each creature in the area. On subsequent rounds, the first time each round you Sustain this Spell, it deals 1d10 bludgeoning damage (basic Reflex save) to each creature in the area.

---
**Heightened (+2)** The initial damage increases by 2d10 and the subsequent damage increases by 1d10.

<actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Prediction" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=132" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 316</row>

**Traditions**
[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** 10 minutes

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You gain a vague glimpse of the future. During the casting of this spell, ask about the results of a particular course of action. The spell can predict results up to 30 minutes into the future and reveal the GM's best guess among the following outcomes: good, bad, mixed (the results will be a mix of good and bad), and nothing (there won't be particularly good or bad results).

 The GM rolls a [secret](/Traits.aspx?ID=142) DC 6 flat check. On a failure, the result is always “nothing.” This makes it impossible to tell whether a “nothing” result is accurate. If anyone asks about the same topic as the first casting of augury during an additional casting, the GM uses the secret roll result from the first casting. If circumstances change, though, it's possible to get a different result.
_source.name: Augury

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [material](/Rules.aspx?ID=282), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 5 willing creatures
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 hour
</row>

</column>

---

You cloak the targets in an illusion, shaping their clothing and worn items into ones suitable for a particular occasion. You visualize the occasion, and the spell creates illusory attire customized to each target. For instance, if you visualized a noble ball, armor would appear to be fine clothing. This doesn't change identifying details of the targets' appearances other than their clothes.

 Any creature that touches the attire, uses the [Seek](/Actions.aspx?ID=84) action to examine it, or otherwise interacts with it can attempt to [disbelieve](/Rules.aspx?ID=267) your illusion.

---
**Heightened (4th)** You can target up to 20 creatures.

**Heightened (5th)** You can target up to 100 creatures.
_source.name: Befitting Attire

<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Standard">
[Blazing Armory](/Spells.aspx?ID=1348)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Fire" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=72" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Rage of Elements](/Sources.aspx?ID=205) pg. 118</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 willing creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 5 minutes
</row>

</column>

---

As long as you have magic, you're never unarmed. You materialize a flaming simulacrum of any common simple or martial weapon into the target's grasp. The target must have a free hand to hold the weapon, or else the weapon falls to the ground in the target's space. The blazing weapon functions as a _+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280)_ weapon, and its damage type changes to fire. The damage type can't be changed using the [versatile](/Traits.aspx?ID=200) trait, modular trait, or similar methods.

A [thrown](/Traits.aspx?ID=195) weapon rematerializes in the target's hand after the Strike is complete. If you choose a ranged weapon that uses ammunition, the wielder must still reload the weapon using the normal number of actions, though this generates ammunition automatically; this functions as normal ammunition, and the _blazing weapon_ can't use other types of ammunition.

 Any creature other than you or the target that attempts to touch, make a Strike with, or [Disarm](/Actions.aspx?ID=41) the weapon takes 1d6 fire damage each time.

---
**Heightened (4th)** You can target up to 5 willing creatures and can choose a different weapon for each target. The weapons function as _+1 striking [flaming](/Equipment.aspx?ID=295)_ weapons.

**Heightened (6th)** As 4th, but the weapons function as _+2 greater striking flaming_ weapons.

**Heightened (8th)** As 4th, but the weapons function as _+3 greater striking greater flaming_ weapons.

**Heightened (10th)** As 4th, but the weapons function as _+3 superior striking greater flaming_ weapons.
_source.name: Blazing Armory

<trait label="Fire" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=72" />
<trait label="Good" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=83" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Kingmaker Companion Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=151) pg. 71</row>

**Traditions**
[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284), [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

A scimitar-shaped beam of fiery light springs from your free hand. While the spell lasts, you can use a single action, which has the [attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15) and [concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32) traits, to burn your foes with the _blazing blade_. When you do, make a spell attack roll. On a success, the _blazing blade_ deals 1d6 fire damage plus 1d6 good damage plus your spellcasting ability modifier. On a critical success, it deals double the usual damage.

---
**Heightened (4th)** The blade's fire damage increases to 2d6. On a critical success, the target takes 1d6 [persistent good damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29).

**Heightened (6th)** The blade's fire damage increases to 3d6. On a critical success, the target takes 2d6 persistent good damage.

**Heightened (8th)** The blade's fire damage increases to 4d6. On a critical success, the target takes 3d6 persistent good damage.
_source.name: Blazing Blade

<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Standard">
[Blazing Bolt](/Spells.aspx?ID=1450)
<actions string="Single Action to Three Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Attack" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=15" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Fire" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=72" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 318</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 60 feet

**Target** 1 or more creatures
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Defense**
AC

</row>

</column>

---

You fire a ray of heat and flame. Make a spell attack roll against a single creature. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 fire damage, and on a critical hit, the target takes double damage.

 For each additional action you use when Casting the Spell, you can fire an additional ray at a different target, to a maximum of three rays targeting three different targets for 3 actions.

 These attacks each increase your multiple attack penalty, but you don't increase your multiple attack penalty until after you make all the spell attack rolls for blazing bolt. If you spend 2 or more actions Casting the Spell, the damage increases to 4d6 fire damage on a hit, and it still deals double damage on a critical hit.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The damage to each target increases by 1d6 for the 1-action version, or by 2d6 for the 2- and 3-action versions.
_source.name: Blazing Bolt

**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 216 2.0 **Tradition** [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3) **Deities** [Angradd](/Deities.aspx?ID=84), [Angradd](/Deities.aspx?ID=84), [Mephistopheles](/Deities.aspx?ID=69), [Ydajisk](/Deities.aspx?ID=148) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** 30 feet **Target** 1 creature **Saving Throw** Will --- A heap of insults and invectives spew from your mouth— words so devastating your foes burn from the intensity of your diatribe. Your words deal 2d6 [persistent fire damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29), and the target must attempt a Will save. If the target doesn't understand the language or you're not speaking a language, it gains a +4 circumstance bonus to its save. **Critical Success** The target is unaffected.
**Success** The target takes half the persistent fire damage.
**Failure** The target becomes [frightened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=19) and takes the full persistent fire damage.
**Critical Failure** The target becomes frightened 2 and takes double the persistent fire damage. --- **Heightened (+2)** You can target two additional creatures, and the persistent damage increases by 2d6.

<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="">
[Blood Duplicate](/Spells.aspx?ID=1214)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Blood Lords</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Conjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=33" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #182: Graveclaw](/Sources.aspx?ID=143) pg. 78</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 non-[magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103) object of 1 Bulk or less
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 hour
</row>

</column>

---

This spell deals you 1 piercing damage as you shape a magical duplicate of the target from your blood; you can't cast this spell if you don't have blood. This spell can't duplicate an item made of precious materials, or materials with a rarity of uncommon or higher. If you're ever more than 5 feet from the duplicate, the spell's duration immediately ends. The Perception DC to recognize the duplicate as false using any sense except touch is equal to 10 + your spellcasting ability modifier + your [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) proficiency bonus. The item feels wet and obviously fake to the touch. When the spell ends, the item collapses into a puddle of blood that quickly evaporates.
_source.name: Blood Duplicate

May contain spoilers from Quest for the Frozen Flame **Source** [Pathfinder #176: Lost Mammoth Valley](/Sources.aspx?ID=113) pg. 76 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Range** 100 feet **Target** 1 creature with a skeleton **Saving Throw** Fortitude --- You reach out a hand and seize a creature's skeleton from afar, harming their body and potentially wrenching them by the bones to move them against their will. The number of actions you spend when Casting this Spell determines the spell's effects. Regardless of the number of actions spent to Cast this Spell, the target must attempt a Fortitude save. ** (somatic, verbal)** You clench your fist, painfully compressing the target's bones and dealing 3d8 bludgeoning damage.
** (material, somatic, verbal)** As the 2-action version, plus you pull the target's body by their bones, moving them around like an awkward marionette. This movement follows the rules for [forced movement](/Rules.aspx?ID=451). **Critical Success** The target is unaffected.
**Success** The target takes half damage. If you cast the 3-action version, you can move the target up to 5 feet; it can choose to fall [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31) to avoid moving.
**Failure** The target takes full damage and is [enfeebled 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=13). If you cast the 3-action version, you can move the target up to 15 feet; it can fall prone to avoid moving.
**Critical Failure** The target takes double damage and is enfeebled 2. If you cast the 3-action version, you can move the target up to 25 feet, then knock the target prone; if you attempt to move the target to a hazardous location, such as into a pool of acid or off a cliff, it can fall prone to avoid moving. --- **Heightened (+2)** The damage increases by 3d8.
_source.name: Boneshaker

May contain spoilers from Extinction Curse **Source** [Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On](/Sources.aspx?ID=21) pg. 78 **Tradition** [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** 30 feet **Area** 10-foot burst **Duration** sustained --- You fill the area with an oppressive, arid swelter that overwhelms creatures with heat exhaustion. Objects are unaffected. Each creature in the area when the spell is cast or that ends its turn in the area afterward must attempt a Fortitude save. Water creatures and plant creatures use the outcome one degree of success worse than the result of their saving throw. Creatures whose bodies contain no significant moisture (such as fire elementals) are immune to _breath of drought_. **Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Failure** The creature is [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34).
**Critical Failure** The creature is sickened 2. --- **Heightened (4th)** Once per round when you [Sustain the Spell](/Actions.aspx?ID=73), you can move the center of the burst to a new location within range. **Heightened (7th)** As the 4th-level version, except the range is 120 feet and the area is a 20-foot burst.
_source.name: Breath of Drought

<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Standard">
[Brine Dragon Bile](/Spells.aspx?ID=1382)
<actions string="Reaction" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Acid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=3" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Water" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=165" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Rage of Elements](/Sources.aspx?ID=205) pg. 172</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

**Trigger** A creature within range takes damage from a slashing or piercing attack, or one that inflicts [persistent bleed damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29).

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** the creature that took damage
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You spit a glob of caustic saltwater that stings the wounds of the creature. Make a ranged spell attack against the triggering creature's AC. On a hit, salt scours its open wound, dealing 2d6 persistent acid damage.

---
**Heightened (+2)** The persistent damage increases by 2d6.
_source.name: Brine Dragon Bile

<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Standard">
[Burrow Ward](/Spells.aspx?ID=1328)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Earth" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=55" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Rage of Elements](/Sources.aspx?ID=205) pg. 94</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Area** 15-foot emanation

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** sustained up to 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You solidify the earth around you, hindering burrowing creatures. Creatures that can't burrow through stone can't burrow through the area. Such creatures already underground within the area must succeed at a Fortitude save or be ejected from the area toward the surface. Those who succeed are forced out of the area but can remain underground. Creatures that can burrow through stone treat the area as [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453).

---
**Heightened (5th)** You create a 30-foot emanation.
_source.name: Burrow Ward

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 319 **Traditions** [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3) **Range** 120 feet **Area** 10-foot burst **Defense** Will **Duration** sustained up to 1 minute --- You forcibly calm creatures in the area, soothing them into a nonviolent state; each creature must attempt a Will save. **Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** Calming urges impose a –1 status penalty to the creature's attack rolls.
**Failure** Any [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60) effects that would affect the creature are suppressed and the creature can't use [hostile actions](/Rules.aspx?ID=300). If the target is subject to hostility from any other creature, it ceases to be affected by _calm_.
**Critical Failure** As failure, but hostility doesn't end the effect.
_source.name: Calm

[Carrion Mire](/Spells.aspx?ID=1909)
<actions string="Three Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Conjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=33" />
<trait label="Negative" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=118" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Wake the Dead #4](/Sources.aspx?ID=219) pg. 29</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [material](/Rules.aspx?ID=282), [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Area** 15-foot burst

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Saving Throw** 
Reflex

**Duration** sustained up to 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

The ground opens into a seemingly endless mass of corpse limbs, grasping at all creatures within the area to drag them down. Creatures in the area when the spell is cast or beginning their t urn in the area must succeed at a Relfex save or fall prone. When a creature in the spell's areas would be healed by a vitality effect, the _carrion mire_ attempts to counteract that effect, preventing that healing but not otherwise prevent the effect if its counteracted.
_source.name: Carrion Mire

[Cauterize Wounds](/Spells.aspx?ID=1349)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Fire" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=72" />
<trait label="Healing" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=89" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Rage of Elements](/Sources.aspx?ID=205) pg. 118</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 60 feet

**Target** up to 5 willing  creatures
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You seal bleeding wounds with fire. Any target that has [persistent bleed damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) can choose to take 1 fire damage. If it does, it can attempt to recover from its persistent bleed damage, with the lower DC for particularly effective assistance. During the spell's duration, you can use a single action, which has the [concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32) trait, to repeat this effect for one target of the spell.
_source.name: Cauterize Wounds

_source.markdown:
**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 216 2.0 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** 30 feet **Target** 1 creature **Saving Throw** Will **Duration** varies --- You speak on the virtue of charity, compelling the target to give away its possessions. The target must attempt a Will save. If the target has no items on its person, the spell fails. **Critical Success** The target is unaffected.
**Success** The target is [stunned 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=36) as it wrestles with the urge.
**Failure** On its next turn, before it does anything else, the target must present the nearest creature with an item in its possession; the target chooses which item to give, and if the only item it has is one that it's currently using to defend itself, such as a weapon during a combat encounter, it can choose to be stunned for 1 round instead of giving up the item. This might require the target to Interact to retrieve an item or move to reach the nearest creature, and handing the item to the target always requires an Interact action.
**Critical Failure** As failure, except the duration is 4 rounds, and the target must repeat the effects of failure on each of its turns. At the end of each of its turns, the target can attempt a new Will save to reduce the remaining duration by 1 round, ending it entirely on a critical success.
_source.name: Charitable Urge

_source.markdown:
<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Standard">
[Clad in Metal](/Spells.aspx?ID=1366)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Metal" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=505" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Rage of Elements](/Sources.aspx?ID=205) pg. 142</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 metal object of 5 Bulk or less that's unattended or attended by a willing creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You briefly swap the outer surface of the metal in an object with a suitable amount of a common [precious](/Traits.aspx?ID=131) metal from the [Plane of Metal](/Planes.aspx?ID=24). You can instead choose an [uncommon](/Traits.aspx?ID=159) or [rare](/Traits.aspx?ID=137) metal if you have access to it or the GM has given you access to it.

 The object functions as an item of that metal, provided the item would be 2nd level or lower. For example, you could make a [dagger](/Weapons.aspx?ID=3) into a [cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=375) or [silver](/Equipment.aspx?ID=379) dagger (2nd-level items) but couldn't make [full plate](/Armor.aspx?ID=13) into [cold iron armor](/Equipment.aspx?ID=140) or [silver armor](/Equipment.aspx?ID=146) (5th-level items). This imparts any special properties of the precious metal—a weapon clad in cold iron activates weaknesses to cold iron, for example—and suppresses any special properties of the original metal of which the item was made.

 The spell neither changes the structural integrity of the item nor damages it. The object can pass a cursory inspection, but the magical effect is obvious to anyone who studies the item closely, so it doesn't alter the Price of the item if you attempt to sell it.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The maximum level of the precious metal increases by 2.
_source.name: Clad in Metal

<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Limited">
[Clawsong](/Spells.aspx?ID=1066)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Strength of Thousands</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #171: Hurricane's Howl](/Sources.aspx?ID=101) pg. 77</row>

**Traditions**
[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 willing creature with an [unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199) claw Strike
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** sustained up to 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You sing a fierce prayer, low and growling, and awaken the ancient spirit of a Terwa beast to guide and strengthen the target's unarmed blows. The target's claw attack gains the [versatile (piercing)](/Traits.aspx?ID=200) trait, and deals 1d6 slashing damage. If the target's claw attack already deals 1d6 slashing damage, it deals 1d8 instead. If its claw attack already had the versatile (piercing) trait, it gains the [deadly 1d8](/Traits.aspx?ID=174) trait.

---
**Heightened (4th)** The spell can affect up to 6 willing creatures with unarmed claw Strikes.
_source.name: Clawsong

<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Standard">
[Cleanse Affliction](/Spells.aspx?ID=1467)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Healing" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=89" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 320</row>

**Traditions**
[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 willing creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

Gentle restorative magic pushes back the effects of toxins and more complex maladies. Choose an affliction on the target, such as a [curse](/Traits.aspx?ID=38), [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), or [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126). If it has advanced past stage one, reduce the stage by one. This reduction can be applied only once to a given case of an affliction, with the case ending when it's completely cured. Although the reduction can't occur again, heightened versions of this spell attempt to counteract with each casting.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** Attempt to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) the affliction if it is a disease or poison.

**Heightened (4th)** Attempt to counteract the affliction if it is a curse, disease, or poison.
_source.name: Cleanse Affliction

<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Standard">
[Cleanse Air](/Spells.aspx?ID=1313)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Air" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=5" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Rage of Elements](/Sources.aspx?ID=205) pg. 70</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 120 feet

**Area** 30-foot burst

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You purify the air in the area, making it clean and breathable. This removes [inhaled](/Traits.aspx?ID=96) [poisons](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), pollution, and similar contaminants from the air but doesn't prevent future contamination. This effect is immediate; for the remaining duration, the spell prevents any further contamination from altering air in the area, including keeping toxic air bordering the area from coming inside. This spell doesn't create air, so casting it underwater wouldn't create breathable air, nor would it affect any toxins within air suspended in the water.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** The area increases to 60 feet.

**Heightened (4th)** The area increases to 120 feet.

**Heightened (6th)** The area increases to 500 feet.

**Heightened (9th)** The area increases to 1 mile.
_source.name: Cleanse Air

<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Standard">
[Clear Mind](/Spells.aspx?ID=1469)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Healing" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=89" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=106" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 320</row>

**Traditions**
[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 willing creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You drive mental contamination from the target's mind. Attempt to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) an effect of your choice imposing one of these conditions on the target: [fleeing](/Conditions.aspx?ID=17), [frightened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=19), and [stupefied](/Conditions.aspx?ID=37). If you failed to counteract the effect but you would have if its counteract rank were 2 lower, instead suppress the effect until the beginning of your next turn. The effect's duration doesn't elapse while it's suppressed. This spell can't counteract or suppress conditions that are part of curses, diseases, or a natural state of the target.

---
**Heightened (4th)** Add [confused](/Conditions.aspx?ID=5), [controlled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=6), and [slowed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35) to the list of conditions.

**Heightened (6th)** Add [doomed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=9) to the list of conditions.

**Heightened (8th)** Add [stunned](/Conditions.aspx?ID=36) to the list of conditions.
_source.name: Clear Mind

<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Standard">
[Create Food](/Spells.aspx?ID=1475)
<actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 321</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** 1 hour

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You create enough food to feed six Medium creatures for a day. This food is bland and unappealing, but it is nourishing. After 1 day, if no one has eaten the food, it decays and becomes inedible. Most Small creatures eat one-quarter as much as a Medium creature (one-sixteenth as much for most Tiny creatures), and most Large creatures eat 10 times as much (100 times as much for Huge creatures and so on).

---
**Heightened (4th)** You can feed 12 Medium creatures.

**Heightened (6th)** You can feed 50 Medium creatures.

**Heightened (8th)** You can feed 200 Medium creatures.
_source.name: Create Food

[Dancing Shield](/Spells.aspx?ID=1111)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Knights of Lastwall](/Sources.aspx?ID=123) pg. 92</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 60 feet

**Target** 1 touched shield and 1 willing creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** sustained up to 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You levitate the touched shield and orbit it around a nearby ally. When you Cast the Spell and Sustain the Spell, the shield uses the [Raise a Shield](/Actions.aspx?ID=98) action to protect the target creature.

---
**Heightened (4th)**  If you have the Shield Block reaction, you can use your reaction to have the target shield use Shield Block when the target creature would take damage from a physical attack, in addition to the usual trigger. In this case, Shield Block protects the target creature, rather than you. Since the shield is using Shield Block and not you, additional effects or abilities that normally apply when you Shield Block don't apply.
_source.name: Dancing Shield

<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Standard">
[Darkness](/Spells.aspx?ID=1480)
<actions string="Three Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Darkness" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=39" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 322</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 120 feet

**Area** 20-foot burst

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You create a shroud of darkness that prevents light from penetrating or emanating within the area. Light does not enter the area and any non-magical light sources, such as a [torch](/Equipment.aspx?ID=60) or [lantern](/Equipment.aspx?ID=29), do not emanate any light while inside the area, even if their light radius would extend beyond the darkness. This also suppresses magical [light](/Traits.aspx?ID=100) of your _darkness_ spell's rank or lower. Light can't pass through, so creatures in the area can't see outside. From outside, it appears as a globe of pure darkness.

---
**Heightened (4th)** Even creatures with [darkvision](/Rules.aspx?ID=415) (but not greater darkvision) can barely see through the darkness. They treat targets seen through the darkness as [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=4).
_source.name: Darkness

<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Standard">
[Dismantle](/Spells.aspx?ID=685)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 218 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 non-magical object in your possession of 1 Bulk or less
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You touch an object, and it immediately disassembles itself into its component pieces. The spell fails if the target lacks component pieces (such as a statue carved from one block of stone), and using it on a dangerous object like a snare or trap typically triggers it. The object gains the [broken](/Conditions.aspx?ID=2) condition, and the component pieces become small enough to be hidden under normal clothing and armor. You can Dismiss the spell.

 When the spell ends, the object reassembles itself into its original form, appearing in your hand or hands if you have them free, or on the ground in front of you otherwise. Once reassembled, the object loses the broken condition and its Hit Points return to the value the object had when you Cast the Spell.

---
**Heightened (4th)** The spell lasts for 10 minutes.

**Heightened (6th)** The spell lasts until your next daily preparations.
_source.name: Dismantle

**Target** 1 spell effect or unattended magic item
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

---

You unravel the magic behind a spell or effect. Attempt a [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) check against the target. If you successfully counteract a magic item, it becomes a mundane item of its type for 10 minutes. This doesn't change the item's non-magical properties. If the target is an [artifact](/Traits.aspx?ID=253) or similar item, you automatically fail.
_source.name: Dispel Magic

**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 104 1.1 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Spell Lists** [Elemental](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=5) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** 120 feet **Area** 20-foot radius burst **Duration** 1 minute --- Select an elemental trait: [air](/Traits.aspx?ID=5), [earth](/Traits.aspx?ID=55), [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72), or [water](/Traits.aspx?ID=165). _Elemental zone_ gains the trait you chose. You imbue the area with the raw energy of that element, creating a zone that emits and amplifies magic of that type. The temperature might suddenly rise or fall, a storm cloud might form, and so on. Spells with the chosen elemental trait cast against creatures in the zone get a +2 status bonus to one damage type the spell deals based on the chosen trait: bludgeoning or electricity for air, bludgeoning for earth, fire for fire, and bludgeoning or cold for water. The caster chooses one type to add the bonus to if the spell deals more than one eligible type. This bonus is halved if the spell didn't use a spell slot (such as a cantrip, focus spell, or innate spell). The zone has no effect on the spell if the spell doesn't deal any damage of an eligible type. Elemental Spell Changes**Source** [_Rage of Elements pg. 55_](/Sources.aspx?ID=205)
Add metal (electricity or slashing damage) and wood (bludgeoning or vitality damage) to the choices. --- **Heightened (+2)** The status bonus increases by 1.
_source.name: Elemental Zone

<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Standard">
[Embed Message](/Spells.aspx?ID=1511)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Illusion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=92" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 328</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Deity**
[Nethys](/Deities.aspx?ID=288)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 object or willing creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** unlimited
</row>

</column>

---

You specify a trigger and a message up to 25 words long. When the specified trigger occurs within 30 feet of the target, illusory text of your message circles the target accompanied by a disembodied voice. You can choose a language you know for the text and speech, and can choose what the voice sounds like. Once the message is completed, the spell ends.

---
**Heightened (4th)** You can add a simple sensory component to emphasize the message, such as an odor, visual effect, or physical sensation. This addition is obviously illusory and part of the message, lasting only while the message is being read.

**Heightened (6th)** As 4th rank, but you can choose how many times the spell repeats the message before it ends; there is no limit to the number of repetitions.
_source.name: Embed Message

<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Standard">
[Empty Pack](/Spells.aspx?ID=1151)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Illusion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=92" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Dark Archive](/Sources.aspx?ID=129) pg. 105</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [material](/Rules.aspx?ID=282), [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 container of 2 Bulk or less
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 hour
</row>

</column>

---

You render every item inside the container you touch invisible, although the container itself remains visible. The items within are [undetected](/Conditions.aspx?ID=39) to all creatures, though a creature can attempt to find an item by reaching into the bag, making an item [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=22) to them instead if they succeed. Additionally, the spell doesn't prevent the items from making protrusions in the bag, adding weight, making noise when jostling around, and so on. However, the spell prevents anything within the container from falling out if it's upended. Any object removed from the container becomes visible and remains visible even if returned to the container.

---
**Heightened (4th)** The duration is until the next time you make your daily preparations.
_source.name: Empty Pack

[Enhance Victuals](/Spells.aspx?ID=101)
<actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 335 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

</row>

**Range** touch

**Target** up to 1 gallon of non-magical water or up to 5 pounds of food
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 hour
</row>

</column>

---

You transform the target into delicious fare, changing water into wine or another fine beverage or enhancing the food's taste and ingredients to make it a gourmet treat.

 Prior to the transformation, the spell attempts to counteract any poisons in the food or water. The food turns back to normal if not consumed before the duration expires, though any poisons that were counteracted are still gone.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The number of gallons of water you can target increases by 1, or the number of pounds of food you can target increases by 5.

<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Standard">
[Enlarge](/Spells.aspx?ID=1514)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Polymorph" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=127" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 329</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Deities**
[Gorum](/Deities.aspx?ID=283), [Iomedae](/Deities.aspx?ID=285), [Rovagug](/Deities.aspx?ID=291)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 willing creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 5 minutes
</row>

</column>

---

Bolstered by magical power, the target grows to size Large. Its equipment grows with it but returns to natural size if removed. The creature is [clumsy 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=3). Its [reach](/Traits.aspx?ID=192) increases by 5 feet (or by 10 feet if it started out Tiny), and it gains a +2 status bonus to melee damage. This spell has no effect on a Large or larger creature.

---
**Heightened (4th)** The creature instead grows to size Huge. The status bonus to melee damage is +4 and the creature's reach increases by 10 feet (or 15 feet if the creature started out Tiny). The spell has no effect on a Huge or larger creature.

**Heightened (6th)** Choose either the 2nd-rank or 4th-rank version of this spell and apply its effects to up to 10 willing creatures.
_source.name: Enlarge

</row>

---

Plants and fungi burst out or quickly grow, entangling creatures. All surfaces in the area are [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453). Each round that a creature starts its turn in the area, it must attempt a Reflex save. On a failure, it takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds until it leaves the area, and on a critical failure, it's also [immobilized](/Conditions.aspx?ID=24) for 1 round. Creatures can attempt to [Escape](/Actions.aspx?ID=79) to remove these effects.

<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Standard">
[Erase Trail](/Spells.aspx?ID=1117)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Knights of Lastwall](/Sources.aspx?ID=123) pg. 93</row>

**Tradition**
[Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 100 feet

**Area** 40-foot burst

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You drastically reduce all signs of one specific creature's passage from the area, including footprints, handprints, dirt, and minor changes caused to the surrounding environment, like the bending of grass. The DC of checks to [Seek](/Actions.aspx?ID=84) or [Search](/Actions.aspx?ID=519) and discover such signs within the area gains a +4 status bonus or is equal to your spell DC, whichever is higher. This spell doesn't repair objects the creature damaged, return slain creatures to life, or remove objects or garbage left behind. It also doesn't prevent others from noticing that the creature's trail ends or begins abruptly outside the area. Finally, this spell doesn't hide the creature from sight or prevent them from leaving new signs of their presence after this spell is cast.

---
**Heightened (+2)**  The range increases by 100 feet, the area increases by 20 feet, and you can remove all signs of 1 additional creature's passage from the area.
_source.name: Erase Trail

**Source** [Gods & Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=17) pg. 107 2.0 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Deities** [Kabriri](/Deities.aspx?ID=76), [Kabriri](/Deities.aspx?ID=76), [Magrim](/Deities.aspx?ID=90), [Magrim](/Deities.aspx?ID=90), [Sairazul](/Deities.aspx?ID=107), [Sairazul](/Deities.aspx?ID=107) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** touch **Area** cube of dirt 5 feet across or smaller --- You remove loose dirt, dust, gravel, sand, and the like (though not solid stone) up to the size of a 5-foot cube. Any Medium or smaller creature standing atop the earth when the spell is cast must attempt a Reflex save or Acrobatics check. **Success** The creature is unaffected and can choose to either descend the pit without damage or move to the nearest available space of its choice.
**Failure** The creature falls [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31) in the nearest available space of its choice, or falls into the pit if it prefers.
**Critical Failure** The creature falls into the pit excavated by the spell and lands prone, taking falling damage as normal. --- **Heightened (+2)** The spell can excavate an additional 5-foot cube of earth. If you excavate all four 5-foot cubes beneath a Large creature, it must attempt a Reflex save or Acrobatics check, as above.
_source.name: Expeditious Excavation

<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Standard">
[Extract Poison](/Spells.aspx?ID=907)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 104 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 poison on or in an object
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

With the lightest touch, you can siphon the poison from an  object and save it for your own later use, making an assassin's blade or politician's wine less deadly while you become all the more so. Attempt a [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) check against one poison you're aware of on or in an object you touch. If you successfully counteract the poison, you negate the object's toxicity and transfer the poison into a weapon you are holding, coating the weapon with a simple but powerful poison. On your next successful attack with that weapon before the end of your next turn, you add 1d6 poison damage per level of the poison you counteracted. On a critically failed attack roll, you lose the extracted poison from your weapon as normal.
_source.name: Extract Poison

<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Standard">
[Falsify Heat](/Spells.aspx?ID=1353)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Fire" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=72" />
<trait label="Illusion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=92" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Rage of Elements](/Sources.aspx?ID=205) pg. 119</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 60 feet

**Target** 1 willing creature or object
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 8 hours
</row>

</column>

---

You veil the signs of the fires of vitality, altering the target's apparent body temperature. This illusion applies to all senses, and a creature that touches the target can attempt to [disbelieve](/Rules.aspx?ID=267) the illusion. You can Dismiss the spell. Choose an illusory body temperature when you cast the spell.

- **Moderate** The target's body temperature appears the same as the surrounding environment, giving the target a +2 circumstance bonus to [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) checks to [Impersonate](/Actions.aspx?ID=46) an [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160), a cold-blooded creature, or an inanimate object (such as a corpse). The target is also invisible to [_heatvision_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1358) and other abilities that sense heat similarly.
- **Warm** The target appears to emit substantial body heat, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Deception checks to Impersonate a warm-blooded creature.

---
**Heightened (4th)** You can target up to 10 creatures, and you can choose a different body temperature for each of them.
_source.name: Falsify Heat

<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Standard">
[Final Sacrifice](/Spells.aspx?ID=689)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
<trait label="Fire" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=72" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 219 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 120 feet

**Target** 1 creature with the [minion](/Traits.aspx?ID=109) trait that you summoned or permanently control
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You channel disruptive energies through the bond between you and your minion, causing it to violently explode. The target is immediately slain, and the explosion deals 6d6 fire damage to creatures within 20 feet of it (basic Reflex save).

 If the target has the [cold](/Traits.aspx?ID=27) or [water](/Traits.aspx?ID=165) trait, the spell instead deals cold damage and gains the cold trait in place of the fire trait. If used on a creature that isn't mindless, this spell has the [evil](/Traits.aspx?ID=64) trait. Attempting to cast this spell targeting a creature that you temporarily seized control of, such as an [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160) commanded by [command undead](/Feats.aspx?ID=277), automatically fails and breaks the controlling effect.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The damage increases by 2d6.
_source.name: Final Sacrifice

You prevent the target item from conducting heat or catching fire for the spell's duration. The item gains fire resistance 10. In addition, effects with the [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72) trait that target the item must first succeed at a [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) check against your spell DC.

---
**Heightened (4th)** The duration is 24 hours.

**Heightened (6th)** The duration is unlimited.

<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Fire" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=72" />

---

You create a fire that burns without fuel and moves to your commands. The flame deals 3d6 fire damage to each creature in the square in which it appears, with a [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save. When you Sustain this spell, you can levitate the flame up to 10 feet. It then deals damage to each creature whose space it shared at any point during its flight. This uses the same damage and save, and you roll the damage once each time you Sustain. A given creature can take damage from _floating flame_ only once per round.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The damage increases by 1d6.

<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Standard">
[Fungal Hyphae](/Spells.aspx?ID=576)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Fungus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=77" />
<trait label="Necromancy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=117" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Gods & Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=17) pg. 108 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Tradition**
[Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Deity**
[Cyth-V'sug](/Deities.aspx?ID=74)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

Thin hyphae grow from your feet and plunge into the earth, creating a symbiotic fungal network that attaches to plants within 30 feet and connects you to their root systems. You gain an imprecise [tremorsense](/Rules.aspx?ID=418) allowing you to sense anything directly touching plants within that distance. If you move, the hyphae snap and the spell ends.

---
**Heightened (4th)** You can control plants in the area to a small degree, allowing you to make Strikes with tree branches, exposed roots, or similarly solid plants. To do so, you use a Strike action, but you can Strike any creature you can detect with your tremorsense. These are melee spell attacks that deal 2d8 bludgeoning damage plus your spellcasting ability modifier. Unusual plants, such as thorny vines, might deal a different type of damage at the GM’s discretion. You can’t make any other attacks through these plants, or take any other actions through them, other than these Strikes.

**Heightened (6th)** As 4th level, but you can use other simple manipulate actions through the plants, including having a branch pick an object up or open a door, though more complex actions, such as picking a lock or disabling a trap, remain impossible.
_source.name: Fungal Hyphae

**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 220 2.0 **Tradition** [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** touch **Area** 15-foot cone **Saving Throw** Fortitude --- Toxic spores swarm over creatures in the area, causing them to erupt in grotesque fungal growths. ---

You project a fragment of your senses into the corpse. While within 500 feet of the corpse (even if it's outside your line of sight or line of effect), you can see from where the target corpse had eyes using your normal visual senses, and you can hear from where the corpse had ears using your normal auditory senses. You can switch between your own vision and hearing, and the corpse's senses, with a single action that has the [concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32) trait. If the corpse naturally lacked eyes or hearing organs in life, you cannot use that sense when using this spell. If the corpse is moved from its location, the spell ends.

---
**Heightened (4th)** The duration increases to 1 hour.

**Heightened (6th)** The duration lasts until the next time you make your daily preparations.
_source.name: Grave Impressions

**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 220 2.0 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** 30 feet **Target** 1 metal item or metal creature --- This spell heats the targeted metal to become red-hot for a moment. This is usually harmless to an unattended metal item, which doesn't get a saving throw, though the GM might rule that flammable materials connected to the object catch fire or melt. If you target an item worn or carried by a creature, or you target a creature made primarily of metal, the heat deals 4d6 fire damage and 2d4 [persistent fire damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) to the creature, which must attempt a Reflex saving throw. If you target an item held by the creature, the creature can Release the item to improve their degree of success by one step from the result of their saving throw. The persistent damage is associated with the object and damages whichever creature is holding or wearing it. It has no effect if no one is holding the item, but you continue to attempt flat checks to end the persistent damage as normal, since the item remains hot and can sear someone who picks it up. **Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** The creature takes half damage and the object deals no persistent fire damage.
**Failure** The creature takes full damage and the object deals full persistent damage.
**Critical Failure** As failure, but the creature takes double damage and the object deals double persistent damage. --- **Heightened (+1)** The initial damage increases by 2d6 and the persistent damage increases by 1d4.
_source.name: Heat Metal

<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Standard">
[Helpful Wood Spirits](/Spells.aspx?ID=1402)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Wood" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=508" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Rage of Elements](/Sources.aspx?ID=205) pg. 196</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Area** 5-foot burst

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** sustained up to 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

Upon casting this spell, a cluster of little wood spirits tumbles into the area. They perform a simple task each round. These spirits are a magical echo of the true spirits that live on the [Plane of Wood](/Planes.aspx?ID=25) and can't be attacked, damaged, or otherwise interfered with. These spirits often look like [kodama](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1202) but can appear in any of the countless varieties of wood spirits that inhabit the Plane of Wood.

 Choose the kind of aid your wood spirits supply from the list below when you Cast the Spell. The first time each round you Sustain the spell, you can move the area occupied by the apparitions up to 10 feet and you can choose the kind of aid they provide this round.

- **Chores** The wood spirits perform a minor manual task of your choice, such as cleaning, opening a door, picking up an unattended object, or carrying an object from one location to another. The spirits can't pick up or carry an object of greater than 2 Bulk.
- **Distract** The wood spirits distract your foes, clambering all over their feet and bodies and being a nuisance. Creatures in the area are [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) unless they succeed at a Reflex save.
- **Obstacle** The wood spirits fill the area as a chaotic, bouncing mass. The area they occupy is [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453).
- **Search** The wood spirits [Seek](/Actions.aspx?ID=84) in the area they occupy, using your Perception check as their own. You learn anything they do from Seeking in this way.
_source.name: Helpful Wood Spirits

<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Standard">
[Humanoid Form](/Spells.aspx?ID=1560)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Polymorph" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=127" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 335</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 10 minutes
</row>

</column>

---

You transform your appearance to that of a Small or Medium humanoid, such as a dwarf, elf, goblin, halfling, human, or orc. You gain the [humanoid](/Traits.aspx?ID=91) trait in addition to your other traits while in this form, as well as any trait related to the creature's kind (such as [goblin](/Traits.aspx?ID=81) or [human](/Traits.aspx?ID=90)). If this transformation reduces your size, it reduces your reach accordingly (typically to 5 feet). This transformation doesn't change your statistics in any way, and you don't gain any special abilities of the humanoid form you assume. You can still wear and use your gear, which changes size (if necessary) to match your new form. If items leave your person, they return to their usual size.

 _Humanoid form_ grants you a +4 status bonus to [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) checks to pass as a generic member of the chosen ancestry, and you add your level even if you're untrained, but you can't make yourself look like a specific person. If you want to [Impersonate](/Actions.aspx?ID=46) an individual, you still need to create a disguise, though the GM won't factor in the difference in ancestry when determining the DC of your Deception check. You can Dismiss this spell.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** You gain [darkvision](/Rules.aspx?ID=415) or [low-light vision](/Rules.aspx?ID=416) if the form you assume has that ability.

**Heightened (5th)** You can take on the appearance of a Large humanoid. If this increases your size, you gain the effects of the [_enlarge_](/Spells.aspx?ID=102) spell.
_source.name: Humanoid Form

<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Standard">
[Illusory Creature](/Spells.aspx?ID=1567)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Auditory" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=16" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Illusion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=92" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Olfactory" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=246" />
<trait label="Visual" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=163" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 336</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 500 feet

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** sustained
</row>

</column>

---

You create an illusory image of a Large or smaller creature. It generates the appropriate sounds, smells, and feels believable to the touch. If you and the image are ever farther than 500 feet apart, the spell ends.

 The image can't speak, but you can use your actions to speak through the creature, with the spell disguising your voice as appropriate. You might need to attempt a [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) or [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12) check to mimic the creature, as determined by the GM. This is especially likely if you're trying to imitate a specific person and engage with someone that person knows. 

In combat, the illusion can use 2 actions per turn, which it uses when you Sustain the spell. It uses your spell attack modifier for attack rolls and your spell DC for its AC. Its saving throw modifiers are equal to your spell DC – 10. It is substantial enough that it can flank other creatures. If the image is hit by an attack or fails a save, the spell ends.

 The illusion can cause damage by making the target believe the illusion's attacks are real, but it cannot otherwise directly affect the physical world. If the illusory creature hits with a Strike, the target takes 3d4 mental damage. The illusion's Strikes are [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188). If the damage doesn't correspond to the image of the monster—for example, if an illusory Large dragon deals only 5 damage—the GM might allow the target to attempt an immediate Perception check to disbelieve the spell. Any relevant resistances and weaknesses apply if the target thinks they do, as judged by the GM. For example, if the illusion wields a warhammer and attacks a creature resistant to bludgeoning damage, the creature would take less mental damage. However, illusory damage does not deactivate regeneration or trigger other effects that require a certain damage type. The GM should track illusory damage dealt by the illusion.

 Any creature that touches the image or uses the [Seek](/Actions.aspx?ID=84) action to examine it can attempt to disbelieve your illusion. When a creature disbelieves the illusion, it recovers from half the damage it had taken from it (if any) and doesn't take any further damage from it.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The damage of the image's Strikes increases by 1d4, and the maximum size of creature you can create increases by one (to a maximum of Gargantuan).
_source.name: Illusory Creature

May contain spoilers from Agents of Edgewatch **Source** [Pathfinder #160: Assault on Hunting Lodge Seven](/Sources.aspx?ID=49) pg. 80 **Traditions** [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** touch **Target** 1 creature **Saving Throw** Fortitude --- You reproduce an [imp's](/Monsters.aspx?ID=109) evil, poisonous sting, stabbing at an enemy and possibly affecting them with the devil's benumbing venom. You deal 1d4 piercing damage to the touched creature and afflict the creature with imp venom. If the target takes piercing damage, they also take 1d6 evil damage and must attempt a Fortitude save. **Critical Success** The target is unaffected.
**Success** The target takes 1d6 poison damage.
**Failure** The target is afflicted with imp venom at stage 1.
**Critical Failure** The target is afflicted with imp venom at stage 2. **Imp Venom** (poison) **Level** 3; **Maximum Duration** 6 rounds; **Stage 1** 1d6 poison and [clumsy 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=3); **Stage 2** 1d6 poison, clumsy 1, and [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35) (1 round).
_source.name: Imp Sting

You expand the target's ability to understand social cues that are normally beyond its comprehension. Any creature to which the target isn't [unfriendly](/Conditions.aspx?ID=40) or [hostile](/Conditions.aspx?ID=23) can use [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) to [Make an Impression](/Actions.aspx?ID=50) on it and to make very simple [Requests](/Actions.aspx?ID=51) of it. This doesn't render the animal any more inclined to help than it otherwise would be.

---
**Heightened (4th)** The spell can also target [plants](/Traits.aspx?ID=125) and [fungi](/Traits.aspx?ID=77).

You attune yourself to an underlying cosmic order to the world. While you remain in tune with this power, you gain a +1 status bonus to Perception checks, saving throws, and skill checks. If you critically fail any check while under the effects of this spell, the bonus ends and you instead have a –1 status penalty to all checks for the remaining duration.

---
**Heightened (5th)** The status bonus increases to +2.

**Heightened (8th)** The status bonus increases to +3.

**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 112 1.1 **Traditions** [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3) **Area** line 60 feet or longer **Saving Throw** [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex --- You gradually manifest your spiritual energy into your cupped hands before firing off a storm of bolts and beams that deal 4d4 force damage to all creatures in a 60-foot line. Creatures in the area must attempt a basic Reflex save. On a critical failure, they're also [blinded](/Conditions.aspx?ID=1) for 1 round. The number of actions you spend when Casting this Spell determines the area. If the line passes through an area of magical [darkness](/Traits.aspx?ID=39) or targets a creature affected by magical darkness, _inner radiance torrent_ attempts to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) the darkness. **(somatic, verbal)** The line is 60 feet long.
**(material, somatic, verbal)** The line is 120 feet long.
**Two Rounds** The line is 120 feet long. If you spend 3 actions casting the spell, you can avoid finishing the spell and spend another 3 actions on your next turn to empower the spell even further. If you choose to do so, the damage dealt by this spell increases by 4d4, and you enter a shining state for 1 minute, causing you to glow with light and deal 1 force damage to creatures that end their turn adjacent to you. --- **Heightened (+1)** The initial damage, as well as the additional damage for the 2-round casting time, each increase by 4d4, and the damage to adjacent creatures dealt while in your shining state increases by 1.
_source.name: Inner Radiance Torrent

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 112 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** 10 minutes ([material](/Rules.aspx?ID=282), [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284))

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 24 hours
</row>

</column>

---

Upon casting this spell, the armor you're wearing is whisked away into an extradimensional space that's linked to you. If the armor is [magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103) and [invested](/Traits.aspx?ID=98) by you, it remains invested while in this space, though you don't gain its benefits. You then gain the Armor Up! action; once you use the action, the spell ends. If the action hasn't been used by the time the spell's duration ends, the extradimensional space collapses, ejecting the armor's pieces on the ground under you.

 **Armor Up!** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104)) **Effect** You snap your fingers. The armor returns to your body.
_source.name: Instant Armor
